wikipedia_page.main: Hilary Adair Marquand,  (24 December 1901 – 6 November 1972) was a British economist and Labour Party politician.

response: Marshall Aid, which had totalled $3.1bn over previous three years, ended officially on 1 January 1951, although in practice it ended six weeks earlier. It was held that the balance of payments was now strong enough for it no longer to be necessary. Harold Wilson (President of the Board of Trade) and George Strauss (Minister of Supply) warned Gaitskell that the burden of rearmament was too much for the shortage of raw materials and manufacturing capacity, but Gaitskell ignored them as they were friends of Bevan. On 27 January 1951 Bevan was reshuffled to the Ministry of Labour with Health, now under Hilary Marquand, downgraded to a non-Cabinet appointment.Dell 1997, p.146 Gaitskell welcomed the changes as reducing an obstacle to economies in health spending.Campbell 2010, p205
*Hilary Marquand, MP for Cardiff East and Minister for Health.
